PROCLAMATION OF A MISSING OR DESTROYED WILL
(1) If a written will has gone missing or has been destroyed without the decedent's intention, and there is no disagreement among the affected parties that the will had existed, the form it was in, the manner in which it went gone missing or in which it was destroyed, or on its contents, the probate court shall examine all the affected parties and take the necessary evidence based on their motions, and then declare the minutes in accordance with the provisions that apply to the proclamation of a written will.
(2) When the estate, if there was no will, would become the property of the Republic of Slovenia, the agreement of the affected parties on the existence of a will and its form and content shall be valid only with the approval of a competent authority.
(3) If among the affected parties there are some who are not capable of taking care of their own affairs, the agreement referred to in paragraphs one and two of this Article shall be valid only with the approval of a competent social services centre.
